but i have made something that turned out very well it is a boat that is going to be tested a lot more (i have time saying we dont have a base yet). its range is just an estimate based on fuel consumption of a smaller length then i did some math (yes i checked it and i was amazed to) and came up with its range at 14,000,000 meters or 14,000 Km. it has a huge top speed (cant reach it for it goes to fast and breaks at around 100. but at 1/6 throttle it holds a nice 20 mph

have not tested laythe or developed any way to get it to laythe just a start to what will be a great way to rescue any lost kerbols (can rescue a kerbol and will develop one that can rescue more. it has about 150 parts (most are struts and wings).

tell me if the size is to big or small.

notice the speed and throttle

Sorry for the delayed release, but ASX-II EURS is finally uploaded!

As I use ISRU mods like Kethane or HOME mod, I was initially going to upload it without provisions for independent tugs, but as Tada requested, it now has rearward docking port for tugs.

I still recommend to use at least ISRU mods, especially HOME admin module; it's always a better idea to have self-sustainability for colonies

But if you do not want use mods, you can still dock tugs into heat shield on LKO.

Just don't forget to deploy landing gears on landing, or rover wheels will burst and since the EURS has already high ground pressure, you CAN NOT repair wheels once over 6 wheels are burst simultaneously!

Edited May 16, 2013 by ssTALONps

Just had a test run on Laythe with ARX-3 to test feasibility of surface-to-orbit refuel operations and to find optimal ascent procedures.

While this maybe not the case of yours, as you don't use ISRU mods, I thought this might give you some figures for managing limited fuel supplies

So I Hyperedited to Laythe orbit, brought down the ARX-3 into one of equatorial islands, burnt excessive fuel and touched down.

After filling up the Vulture with Hyperedit, I sat my target orbit as 90x90km equatorial orbit.

The result is greater then expected. The key to increased efficiency is to not engage 24-77s at all time, not to mention Laythe's thinner atmosphere and lower gravity.

Here is my ascent profile;


1. Rotate at 80m/s, pitch up to 60 deg, engage ASAS and initiate jet only ascent phase.
2. At altitudes of 10km, ignite LV-T30 by pressing 6.
3. At altitudes of 12km, disengage jet engines and close intakes by pressing 1 and 3 respectively.
4. At altitudes of 25km, pitch down to 40 deg.
5. At altitudes of 30km, pitch down to 20 deg.
6. At altitudes of 40km, pitch down to prograde vector and burn until desired AP is achieved.
7. ???
8. PROFIT!

Despite cutbacks in the defense budget (thank Kod), I feel that only having a couple of fighters in-system isn't doing much if someone takes exception to you dropping colonies.

So I think I can assist by providing a basic armament for anything with a docking port- the TSM-202A Tactical Smart Missile.

Essentially a probe core with solar panels, an RCS tank, a couple of thrusters, and a boost unit, the TSM ejects, lines up with the target via RCS, closes in, and then kicks in Seperatron boosters for a real punch. testing it, the Starwolf Corporation has discovered it can punch through most light armors and positively eats up any unarmored vessel. Due to the RCS system, it can be highly accurate in targeting, rendering a ship inert without killing it's crew. I'll post up a picture and .craft later today.

Comes in two versions- both Clamp-o-Tron and C-o-T jr. models. TSM-202A and TSM-202B, respectively.

ssTALONps: Thanks! IÃ‚Â´m just waiting for supplies to be delivered to our Vall station and then IÃ‚Â´ll start delivering SSTOs and colony pieces to ground. Vulture is gonna be used as an atmospheric/orbit capable fighter to provide security to our ground operations. Thank you for finding out the propper way to launch from Laythe - much work saved

The Error: Our missiles are pretty much standardised at the moment and I donÃ‚Â´t wanna use any new ones because.

IÃ‚Â´m currently working to make most of our Laythe based aircrafts compatible for ground refueling. Greatest problem was with Grif SAR (KV-2 Griffon by Zombiphylax) cause it was very delicate to balance, but I think I got it all right. It is a great small VTOL for SAR operations in 90km radius around base.

So more testing done - that Grif SAR has range of 220km, so it can go on 100km rescue missions and still return safely (20km given as a margin for take-off and landing). Very stable, easy to land, flies around 100m/s at a sea level.

ItÃ‚Â´ll be maybe used to travel between different colony locations intsead of planes.

But weÃ‚Â´ve to figure out, how to get them to Laythe. They arenÃ‚Â´t exactly SSTOs

hey i have an idea,why don't you make a VTOL with a hichiker module to make a surface-air transfer vehicle.
I have something like that somwhere in computer, but it is really hard to make reliable easy to fly VTOL
the trick is use better engines and two avionics modules (you may as well for more stability add a second pair of engines).

Ok, give it a try

Some pictures of todays testing:

Haha, that's pretty rad, how hard was it to rebalance it with those docking ports?

Not hard at all! To be brutally honest it is totaly flyable without rebalancing!

I just moved the 2 girders just a tiny bit forward to keep original little bit to the back balance and as I consume fuel it shifts little bit forward to neutral hover and when youÃ‚Â´re almost dry it is just tiny bit forward. I love it! BEST VTOL EVER!
